lines.text: How about joining the posse, Johnny? It would give you a chance to use that shooting iron legal for a change.
Just a minute! I'm probably wasting my breath, but I'm going to give you some advice. Get out of town pronto. Get yourself a job and quit poker. Poker is a man's game.
I can take care of myself.

Oh sure, I know your fast with your guns, but sooner or later you'll meet a man that's faster or that doesn't fight square and then you're off to Boot Hill. No, you're bucking a sucker's game, Kid. You can't beat it.
I guess that's good advice, Marshal, but I ain't takin' it. Besides, how to handle a six-gun and poker is all I know.
I'm reformed, but my friend here isn't. His name is Blake from Tombstone... and he don't like marshals.
Maybe there's a good reason why you don't like marshals.
None of 'em lived long enough for us to get acquainted.
You've been meeting the wrong kind of marshals.
Lightning, Johnny has been talking big since word got around you were wounded. He figured it's bound to slow you down.
I never had much respect for Johnny's figuring.

[to Blake]
If you're in Silver City after sundown, Rat Face, I'll throw you in jail.

[to Silver]
When are you gonna start shavin', kid?
Maybe this is your way of getting Rat Face back, huh? Even swap - Rat Face for Rod? That your idea, Johnny?
You're scratchin' in the wrong place!
The only way to turn up worms is by scratchin' for them!
